body:
Perhaps obvious, but I would prefer a system that is robust to client clock.

Otherwise, sounds fine to me.

Every startup (NECESARY TO handles experiment tagging for ongoing
At least once per day for ongoing sessions.

Derail: Is there some etag/caching magic to allow more often than once per
day cheaply?

On Fri, Mar 24, 2017 at 3:48 PM Mike Cooper <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I propose that we use this opportunity to decouple our execution from the
> browser start. Instead I suggest that we keep a record of the last time we
> have run. If it has been more than 24 hours since the last run, run again.
> We would check at browser start up, and then again periodically. In pseudo
> code:
>
> on browser start, and every 30 minutes
>     if last_run is more than 24 hours ago
>         run()
>         last_run = now
>
